sys_metadata_link.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_431105_cand_ass_question_library"> <x_431105_cand_ass_question_library action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <answers>Wait for your manager for as long as it takes. When they arrive pretend that everything is fine and do your best to behave professionally.
MOST EFFECTIVE LEASTEFFECTIVE Wait for your manager for as long as it takes, but when they do come back explain that it has been a long week, you're tired and that you feel they have been unreasonable in asking you to wait for so long
MOST EFFECTIVE LEASTEFFECTIVE Try to call your manager on their mobile to see where they are and whether they still want you to wait. If you can't get hold of them leave them a message then go home. You've done your best to contact them and they can't reasonably expect you to wait for them indefinitely
MOST EFFECTIVE LEASTEFFECTIVE Decide to leave. Assume that they have probably forgotten they asked you to wait for them, and even if they haven't, accept that you have waited as long as could be considered reasonable.
MOST EFFECTIVE LEASTEFFECTIVE</answers> <assessment_state display_value="Preselection CBT">5165ad5897442110a4deb9dfe153af6f</assessment_state> <correct_answer>Decide to leave. Assume that they have probably forgotten they asked you to wait for them, and even if they haven't, accept that you have waited as long as could be considered reasonable.
MOST EFFECTIVE LEASTEFFECTIVE</correct_answer> <default_max_value>11</default_max_value> <number>QLB0001015</number> <question>You’ve had a really long and tiring week and you’re looking forward to going home for the weekend. Ten minutes before you’re about to leave your manager asks if they can have a quick word and asks you to wait whilst they quickly catch a colleague in IT. An hour later they have not returned.
Please consider the situation and then select which statement you feel is the most effective and the least effective response or action from the four statements.</question> <selection_criteria display_value="Situational Judgement (SJT)">d24e91d097442110a4deb9dfe153af4c</selection_criteria> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2022-12-24 14:56:18</sys_created_on> <sys_id>6db07d9497842110a4deb9dfe153af43</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>3</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2022-12-25 06:44:32</sys_updated_on> </x_431105_cand_ass_question_library> </record_update>
